data.data: Initial comments:This report is for equipment replacement of nurse call systems in the following rooms: Clean Utility (SCG112); Decontamination Room (SCG113); Staff Lounge (SCG099A); Toilet Room (SCG097); Toilet Room (SCG103); Toilet Room (SCG104); Patient Treatment Room (SCG101A); Patient Treatment Room (SCG101B); Patient Treatment Room (SCG102); Patient Treatment Room (SCG105); Patient Treatment Room (SCG106); Patient Treatment Room (SCG107); Patient Treatment Room (SCG109); and Patient Treatment Room (Bed 1-5) (SCG111), effective February 13, 2024.  UPMC Hamot attested they were in full compliance with requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospital, 28 PA Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998. Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is for equipment replacement of nurse call systems in the following rooms: Clean Utility (SCG112); Decontamination Room (SCG113); Staff Lounge (SCG099A); Toilet Room (SCG097); Toilet Room (SCG103); Toilet Room (SCG104); Patient Treatment Room (SCG101A); Patient Treatment Room (SCG101B); Patient Treatment Room (SCG102); Patient Treatment Room (SCG105); Patient Treatment Room (SCG106); Patient Treatment Room (SCG107); Patient Treatment Room (SCG109); and Patient Treatment Room (Bed 1-5) (SCG111), effective February 13, 2024.  UPMC Hamot attested they were in full compliance with requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospital, 28 PA Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998. Plan of Correction:

Initial comments:This report is the result of an occupancy survey conducted on November 30, 2023, at UPMC Hamot, which included Cath Lab Patient Rooms 1-8 and Support areas.  Based on the occupancy survey, it was determined the facility was in compliance with all applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 Pa Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998 and the current edition of the Guidelines for Design and Construction of Hospital and Health Care Facilities. Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of an occupancy survey conducted on November 30, 2023, at UPMC Hamot, which included Cath Lab Patient Rooms 1-8 and Support areas.  Based on the occupancy survey, it was determined the facility was in compliance with all applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 Pa Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998 and the current edition of the Guidelines for Design and Construction of Hospital and Health Care Facilities. Plan of Correction:

Facility attestations for the following were reviewed:Perinatal Consultive Liaison Psychiatry TelemedicinePregnancy and Women's Recovery Center TelemedicineRauland Responder 5 Nurse Call System (4 South)Rauland Responder 5 Nurse Call System (4 North Old Hip - Knee Unit)Rauland Responder 5 Nurse Call System (Dialysis)Rauland Responder 5 Nurse Call System (5 Main)It was determined the facility was in compliance with the applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health ' s Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 Pa Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998.   Plan of Correction:

Initial comments:This report is the result of an unannounced complaint investigation (CEN23C073A) completed on August 23, 2023, at UPMC Hamot.  It was determined that the facility was in compliance with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 PA Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998. Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of an unannounced complaint investigation (CEN23C073A) completed on August 23, 2023, at UPMC Hamot.  It was determined that the facility was in compliance with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 PA Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998. Plan of Correction:

Initial comments:This report is the result of an unannounced onsite special monitoring survey completed on June 6, 2023, at UPMC Hamot, with additional documentation review completed on June 7, 2023.  It was determined that the facility was not in compliance with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 PA Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998. Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of an unannounced onsite special monitoring survey completed on June 6, 2023, at UPMC Hamot, with additional documentation review completed on June 7, 2023.  It was determined that the facility was not in compliance with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 PA Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998. Plan of Correction: 51.5 (a) LICENSURE BUILDING OCCUPANCY:51.5. Building Occupancy (a) A new construction, alterations  
or renovations that provide space for  
patient or resident rooms or services  
may not be used or occupied until  
authorization for occupancy has been  
received from the Department.Observations:Based on review of facility documents and e-mail correspondence, it was determined that the facility replaced and put in use a nurse call system without approval from the Department (Department of Health - Division of Acute and Ambulatory Care).  Findings include:Review of a hospital attestation requesting to use replacement equipment, dated May 15, 2023, revealed, "... Name of new or replacement equipment: ... Nurse Call System (2nd Floor PACU). ... Date the new or replacement equipment will be placed in use: 05/01/2023. ... Attestation on behalf of the health care facility named above by: EMP1 (Print Name) EMP1 (Sign Name) Date: 05/15/2023 ..."On May 15, 2023, e-mail correspondence was received from EMP2, which stated, "Please see the attached attestation for Hamot's Ongoing Nurse Call System upgrade. ..."    Plan of Correction - To be completed: 09/20/2023The Director of Patient Safety, Quality, Infection Prevention, Regulatory Accreditation and the Director of Facilities & Construction are ultimately responsible for the implementation of this plan of correction.  They will further coordinate with appropriate internal staff and external vendor(s) to support the action plan. UPMC Hamot is taking the following corrective actions to ensure replacement equipment is not put into use without the appropriate approval from the PA Department of Health - Division of Acute and Ambulatory Care:1. On June 9, 2023 the Safety, Quality, Regulatory Specialist informed the VP of Operations and the Director of Patient Safety, Quality, Infection Prevention, Regulatory Accreditation of a citation for use of replacement equipment prior to DOH approval and the need to follow-up with the Project Planning team regarding DOH attestations for new or replacement equipment.2. On June 13, 2023 the VP of Operations met with the Director of Facilities & Construction to discuss the need for timely project updates and the expectations relative to required DOH attestations for new or replacement equipment.3. On June 14, 2023 the Safety, Quality, Regulatory Specialist spoke with the Construction Project Manager for the Nurse Call System Replacement project to clarify the need for timely notifications and relevant information in order to complete/submit required DOH attestations for new or replacement equipment.  The Construction Project Manager provided a project update and advised he would follow-up accordingly with the vendor for the Nurse Call System. 4. On June 21, 2023 the Safety, Quality, Regulatory Specialist shared the DOH finding with Hamot's Patient Safety & Quality Committee and educated leaders on the expectation regarding attestations for new or replacement equipment and new services.5. On August 1, 2023 the Safety, Quality, Regulatory Specialist reached out to the Construction Project Manager for the ongoing Nurse Call System Replacement project to check on any updates. 6. On August 9, 2023 (upon receiving notification that the Construction Project Manager for the Nurse Call System Replacement project would be leaving Hamot) the Safety, Quality, Regulatory Specialist reached out to the Senior Construction Project Manager and Facilities Engineering Construction Coordinator for a project update on the remainder of the nurse call system replacements.  The DOH finding was reiterated as well as the expectation regarding attestations for new or replacement equipment.7. On August 22, 2023 the Safety, Quality, Regulatory Specialist sent a follow-up communication to the Director of Facilities & Construction and the Project Planning team regarding the DOH plan of correction submission and the expectation regarding attestations for new or replacement equipment.  Hamot's new Interim President was also apprised.8. On September 20, 2023 the Safety, Quality, Regulatory Specialist will update Hamot's Patient Safety & Quality Committee on the DOH plan of correction submission and provide a reminder to leaders about the expectation regarding attestations for new or replacement equipment and new services.9. The Safety, Quality, Regulatory Specialist will continue to work with the Project Planning team to facilitate and improve communication for current and future projects to ensure DOH approval is obtained before any new or replacement equipment is put into use.  Any concerns will be brought to the attention of the Director of Patient Safety, Quality, Infection Prevention, Regulatory Accreditation and the Director of Facilities & Construction as well as the VP of Operations to be addressed as necessary. 51.5 (a) LICENSURE BUILDING OCCUPANCY: 51.5. Building Occupancy (a) A new construction, alterations  
or renovations that provide space for  
patient or resident rooms or services  
may not be used or occupied until  
authorization for occupancy has been  
received from the Department. Observations:Based on review of facility documents and e-mail correspondence, it was determined that the facility replaced and put in use a nurse call system without approval from the Department (Department of Health - Division of Acute and Ambulatory Care).  Findings include:Review of a hospital attestation requesting to use replacement equipment, dated May 15, 2023, revealed, "... Name of new or replacement equipment: ... Nurse Call System (2nd Floor PACU). ... Date the new or replacement equipment will be placed in use: 05/01/2023. ... Attestation on behalf of the health care facility named above by: EMP1 (Print Name) EMP1 (Sign Name) Date: 05/15/2023 ..."On May 15, 2023, e-mail correspondence was received from EMP2, which stated, "Please see the attached attestation for Hamot's Ongoing Nurse Call System upgrade. ..."    Plan of Correction - To be completed: 09/20/2023The Director of Patient Safety, Quality, Infection Prevention, Regulatory Accreditation and the Director of Facilities & Construction are ultimately responsible for the implementation of this plan of correction.  They will further coordinate with appropriate internal staff and external vendor(s) to support the action plan. UPMC Hamot is taking the following corrective actions to ensure replacement equipment is not put into use without the appropriate approval from the PA Department of Health - Division of Acute and Ambulatory Care:1. On June 9, 2023 the Safety, Quality, Regulatory Specialist informed the VP of Operations and the Director of Patient Safety, Quality, Infection Prevention, Regulatory Accreditation of a citation for use of replacement equipment prior to DOH approval and the need to follow-up with the Project Planning team regarding DOH attestations for new or replacement equipment.2. On June 13, 2023 the VP of Operations met with the Director of Facilities & Construction to discuss the need for timely project updates and the expectations relative to required DOH attestations for new or replacement equipment.3. On June 14, 2023 the Safety, Quality, Regulatory Specialist spoke with the Construction Project Manager for the Nurse Call System Replacement project to clarify the need for timely notifications and relevant information in order to complete/submit required DOH attestations for new or replacement equipment.  The Construction Project Manager provided a project update and advised he would follow-up accordingly with the vendor for the Nurse Call System. 4. On June 21, 2023 the Safety, Quality, Regulatory Specialist shared the DOH finding with Hamot's Patient Safety & Quality Committee and educated leaders on the expectation regarding attestations for new or replacement equipment and new services.5. On August 1, 2023 the Safety, Quality, Regulatory Specialist reached out to the Construction Project Manager for the ongoing Nurse Call System Replacement project to check on any updates. 6. On August 9, 2023 (upon receiving notification that the Construction Project Manager for the Nurse Call System Replacement project would be leaving Hamot) the Safety, Quality, Regulatory Specialist reached out to the Senior Construction Project Manager and Facilities Engineering Construction Coordinator for a project update on the remainder of the nurse call system replacements.  The DOH finding was reiterated as well as the expectation regarding attestations for new or replacement equipment.7. On August 22, 2023 the Safety, Quality, Regulatory Specialist sent a follow-up communication to the Director of Facilities & Construction and the Project Planning team regarding the DOH plan of correction submission and the expectation regarding attestations for new or replacement equipment.  Hamot's new Interim President was also apprised.8. On September 20, 2023 the Safety, Quality, Regulatory Specialist will update Hamot's Patient Safety & Quality Committee on the DOH plan of correction submission and provide a reminder to leaders about the expectation regarding attestations for new or replacement equipment and new services.9. The Safety, Quality, Regulatory Specialist will continue to work with the Project Planning team to facilitate and improve communication for current and future projects to ensure DOH approval is obtained before any new or replacement equipment is put into use.  Any concerns will be brought to the attention of the Director of Patient Safety, Quality, Infection Prevention, Regulatory Accreditation and the Director of Facilities & Construction as well as the VP of Operations to be addressed as necessary.

Initial comments:This report is the result of an occupancy survey conducted on July 13, 2023, at UPMC Hamot, which included Room TB13 - Clean Linen Storage.  Based on the occupancy survey, it was determined the facility was in compliance with all applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 Pa Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998 and the current edition of the Guidelines for Design and Construction of Hospital and Health Care Facilities. Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of an occupancy survey conducted on July 13, 2023, at UPMC Hamot, which included Room TB13 - Clean Linen Storage.
